questions.question: What is a software-defined network (SDN)?
questions.explanation: SDN: separates control/data planes. Controller: centralized control. Benefits: flexibility, automation. Implementation: OpenFlow protocol. Adoption: growing. Importance: future direction.

questions.question: What is network function virtualization (NFV)?
questions.explanation: NFV: software-based functions. Examples: firewall, router, load balancer (virtual). Benefits: flexibility, cost. Deployment: cloud, servers. Technology: hypervisor-based. Importance: emerging.

questions.question: What is SD-WAN?
questions.explanation: SD-WAN: programmable wide-area network. Controller: centralized management. Benefit: cost reduction, flexibility. Implementation: overlay network. Adoption: increasing. Importance: enterprise WAN.

questions.question: What is OpenFlow?
questions.explanation: OpenFlow: separates control/forwarding. Standard: for programmable networks. Flow: rules-based forwarding. Adoption: SDN foundation. Implementation: switches, controllers. Importance: SDN enabler.

questions.question: What is a network tap?
questions.explanation: Tap: mirrors network traffic. Purpose: monitoring, analysis. Passive: no latency. Tool: packet analyzers. Application: IDS, troubleshooting. Importance: visibility tool.

questions.question: What is port mirroring?
questions.explanation: Mirroring: copies traffic to port. Purpose: monitoring, analysis. Active: configuration needed. Tool: analyzers, IDS. Limitation: impacts performance. Importance: monitoring.

questions.question: What is network segmentation?
questions.explanation: Segmentation: logical/physical separation. Purpose: security, performance. Methods: VLANs, subnets, firewalls. Benefit: contain breaches. Implementation: complex. Importance: security strategy.

questions.question: What is converged infrastructure?
questions.explanation: Infrastructure: unified system. Benefits: simplified, efficient. Deployment: data center. Technology: hyperconverged (HCI). Advantage: management ease. Importance: modern data centers.

questions.question: What is QoS (Quality of Service)?
questions.explanation: QoS: ensures service quality. Methods: classification, marking, queuing. Purpose: performance guarantees. Application: VoIP, video. Technology: DiffServ. Importance: service guarantee.

questions.question: What is traffic shaping?
questions.explanation: Shaping: smooths traffic rate. Purpose: congestion prevention. Method: token/leaky bucket. Benefit: predictable service. Implementation: edges routers. Importance: congestion management.
